4.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

9.text: Together they make up the Eggheads -

12.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.text: The question is - can they be beaten?

23.text: Welcome to Eggheads - the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

27.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

30.text: They are the Eggheads, and I don't even know why I say possibly. You clearly are, aren't you?

34.text: Hostage to fortune if you say that, Jeremy.

36.text: Look at them very quietly saying, "Yes, we are."

39.text: Taking on the awesome might of the Eggheads today

44.text: This team of colleagues all work for the same youth charity

47.text:
- based in the New Forest. Let's meet them. 
- Hi. I'm Chris.

54.text: Hi. I'm Alice. I'm a PR and social media officer.

58.text: Hi, I'm Dulcie and I'm a lead youth officer.

61.text: Hi, I'm Jan and I'm a youth services manager.

64.text:
- Hi, I'm Kat and I'm a youth advisor. 
- So, Chris, team, welcome. 
- Thank you.

68.text: Good to see you. The youth charity is called what?

72.text: It's called It's Your Choice. It's been around for 28 years.

75.text: We support around 3,500 young people a year who live

79.text: in and around the New Forest on issues like homelessness

82.text: and mental health, supporting young people into education,

88.text: Some young people have issues with substance misuse.

93.text: Whatever they need, we give them support with that.

95.text: I'm thinking this is right up your street, CJ. The sort of thing you support.

98.text: It's the sort of work I am very much involved with.

101.text: Especially homelessness. That's an absolute passion of mine.

104.text:
- It's a huge problem where we work. 
- And tell me about the quizzing.

108.text: At what point do you get together, put all that to one side and have a serious quiz?

113.text: We've quizzed individually, but not as a team,

117.text: so we're starting right at the top.

120.text: You've come together today as individual quizzers to make a team.

124.text:
- That's correct. 
- Well, good luck against the Eggheads.

127.text: Every day there is £1,000 of cash up for grabs for our Challengers.

130.text: However, if they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

133.text: that prize money rolls over to our next show. Now, Right Choice,

137.text: I can tell you the Eggheads are on one heck of a roll.

141.text:
- They've won the last 23 games. 
- Wow!

143.text: But you know what that means.

147.text: That's the money that says you can't beat them.

150.text: I'd love you to do it. Mustn't say that.

155.text:
- Who would like this? 
- Who's going to take Geography, guys?

159.text:
- Isn't that you, Kat? 
- That's me, isn't it?

166.text:
- Let's see if we can peel them apart.

169.text:
- Do you want to go for Barry? 
- That's fine. 
- Try Barry. 
- Take Barry.

174.text:
- We'll go for Barry, please, Jeremy. 
- OK.

176.text: So, Kat from Right Choice versus Barry from the Eggheads.

179.text: Any questions on Japan, Barry likes. There the whole time, aren't you?

187.text: take your positions in our Question Room?

- So, you travel a bit, Kat? 
- Yeah. Try to.

- No. Not at the moment anyway.

200.text:
- How is the driving test going? 
- It's going OK. I'm persisting, at best.

209.text:

216.text:
- Like you reverse instead of driving forward?

222.text: You know. I've done numerous things.

225.text: I've driven into things, I've closed my eyes when a lorry went past.

228.text: It's just not good. I'm going to get a horse.

230.text: There was somebody in the area my parents live who...

233.text: The examiner fell out of the car when they were taking a corner.

237.text: I haven't done that yet, so, I mean... There's time.

240.text:
- One for your bucket list. Good luck. I hope you pass soon. 
- Thank you.

247.text:

- All of us. 
- I mean it could be...

1653.text:
- It could be because Alexandra was known as "Alix"... 
- Alix of Hesse.

1656.text: ..so we could be being fooled by that, but we're not sure, basically.

1660.text: We should know this, but we don't think it's Louise.

1665.text: A little bit of a problem with the other two,

1668.text: but, on balance, we'll go for Alice.

1676.text: You have got it right. The answer is Alice.

1679.text: Well done, Eggheads, we say congratulations. You've won again.

1687.text: Always fascinating, when they have to work their way to it.

1692.text: They won on a difficult question

1694.text: and they've done what comes naturally to them.

1697.text: so it does mean you won't be going home with the £24,000.

1700.text: The money rolls over to our next show. Eggheads, well done.

1705.text: but there are just moments when I wonder.

1708.text: Join us next time to see if a new team of Challengers

1711.text: will have the brains to defeat them and win £25,000.
